body.p:
Clarksburg Lewis Co Kentucky
Feby 25th 1861
His Excellency B. Magoffin governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner would here state that on the knight of the 12th instant one Samuel McRoberts broke the Jail of this county and has fled from Justice and is still running at large said McRoberts has been Indited by the Gand Jury of ^this^ county for horse stealing some time since -- he is despirate man having broken some several Jails before he broke the Jail of Mason & Fleming countys, and it is very necessary he should be brought to Justice. I would therefore petition your Excellency to offer a reward for the apprehention of said McRoberts that he may be dealt with according to law, this ^is^ one of the most Extreme cases in all my knowledge and I think it very necessary that there should be some thing of that kind done in order to protect person & property
I herewith send you a letter writen to me by Col R. H. Stanton the district atto for this Judicial district
Please grant this favor and oblige the Citizens of this community

Yours Respecty
J. R. Garland Judge
of this Lewis county court
